result.execSummary:
The defendant Devontae L Kohnke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expunction will be granted on all three misd counts if deft successfully completes probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with victims.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

Minutes:  15CF882/15CM1112.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Ben Schwarz.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.

Credit for 260 days.  Deft is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Ct 2 - sentenced to 10 days KCJ concurrent.  Any unpaid financial obligations on count 2 shall be rolled into sentence. 

15CM1112 - deft sentenced to 50 days KCJ concurrent to count 1 of 15CF882.  Any unpaid financial obligations shall be rolled into sentence.
